alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. John The Baptist; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:25PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. John The Baptist, northern Ascension, West Baton Rouge, southwestern St. Helena, southeastern Pointe Coupee, Livingston, Iberville and East Baton Rouge Parishes through 330 PM CDT... At 225 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Albany to near Livonia. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Gonzales, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Addis, Brusly, Livingston, Livonia, Sorrento, French Settlement, Maringouin, Rosedale, Port Vincent and Grosse Tete. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 128 and 180. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. John The Baptist; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension
